src:
KPK Kembali Periksa 7 Saksi Kasus OTT Walikota Medan
01 Nov 2019, 14:13 by Dadan SF


KPK Kembali Periksa 7 Saksi Kasus OTT Walikota Medan

KBRN, Medan: Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) kembali melakukan pemeriksaan terhadap sejumlah saksi dugaan suap terkait proyek dan jabatan di pemerintahan kota Medan tahun anggaran 2019, yang menetapkan tiga orang sebagai tersangka termasuk Walikota Medan Tengku Dzulmi Eldin. Pemeriksaan dilakukan di kantor Kejaksaan Tinggi Sumatera Utara (Kejatisu), mulai Jumat (1/11) pagi. 
Pemanggilan terhadap sejumlah saksi juga salah satu dugaan indikasi ikut dalam perjalanan dinas Walikota Medan ke Jepang,  sekaligus terlibat menyumbangkan dana perjalanan dinas tanpa dana APBD.
Dari pantauan RRI, tim penyidik KPK melakukan pemeriksaan sejak pukul 09.00 wib, di gedung Tri Krama Adhyaksa. Setelah menjalani pemeriksaan hingga menjelang pukul 12.00 wib, sejumlah saksi keluar dari dalam gedung. Dimulai dari Kadis Kesehatan Kota Medan Edwin Effendi yang keluar sekira pukul 11.30 wib. Dicerca beberapa pertanyaan oleh wartawan, Edwin berjalan cepat menuju mobil seraya menjawab singkat. Edwin mengaku hanya ditanya soal tugas pokok dan fungsinya sebagai Kadis Kesehatan Kota Medan. Namun, Edwin enggan menjelaskan secara rinci. 
"Enggaklah, artinya sesuai dengan tugas fungsi dan pokok. Ya, gak usah di foto - foto lah dek," ucap Effendi.
Edwin juga mengaku tidak ikut dalam rombongan perjalanan dinas Walikota Medan ke Jepang terkait kerjasama sister city. "Enggak ada, enggak (ikut ke Jepang). Saya sesuai dengan tugas pokok dan fungsi saya. Oke ya dek," jawab Effendi. 
Kemudian tidak lama berselang Kabag Umum Kota Medan M Andi Syahputra juga keluar, namun memilih bungkam. Tidak lama berselang berlanjut rombongan saksi lain terdiri dari Kadis Pengendalian Penduduk dan Keluarga Bencana Usma Polita Nasution, Kadis Perumahan Kawasan Permukiman dan penataan ruang Benny Iskandar, Kadis Pendidikan Kota Medan Marasutan Siregar, Staf protokoler Walikota Medan Andika keluar sekira pukul 12.10 wib.
Namun tidak ada satupun saksi yang bisa dimintai keterangan terkait pemeriksaan di dalam oleh tim KPK. Terakhir, Kadis Pariwisata Medan Agus Suriyono juga keluar dari dalam gedung. Tidak banyak yang dikatakan Suriyono. Ia hanya menjawab singkat.
"Salat dulu ya. Mau Salat dulu," ucapnya singkat sambil masuk ke dalam mobil.
Hingga pukul 13.00 wib, sejumlah tim KPK masih berada di kantor Kejatisu. Pada pukul 13.15 wib sejumlah saksi tampak kembali lagi memasuki ruang penyidikan.
Seperti Kadis Pendidikan Medan Marasutan Siregar, Kadis Pariwisata Medan Agus Suriyono, Kadis Perumahan Kawasan Permukiman dan penataan ruang Benny Iskandar, dan Kabag Umum Kota Medan M Andi Syahputra. 
Namun tiga saksi yang sebelumnya diperiksa belum kembali ke Kejatisu. Ketiganya Kadis Kesehatan Kota Medan Edwin Effendi, Kadis Pengendalian Penduduk dan Keluarga Bencana Usma Polita Nasution, serta staf protokoler Walikota Medan Andika.
Sementara dua saksi yang seperti informasi KPK sebelumnya turut dipanggil hari ini yakni kepala Bappeda Kota Medan Irwan Ritonga dan Kabid Pemberdayaan Masyarakat Dinas Pemberdayaan Perempuan Ernest Sembiring belum tampak hadir ke Kejatisu. 
Seperti informasi dari juru bicara KPK, Febry Diansyah, Jumat (1/11/2019), tim penyidik KPK kembali memeriksa 7 (tujuh) orang sebagai saksi untuk tersangka yang turut melibatkan walikota Medan Tengku Dzulmi Eldin.
"Hari ini KPK mengagendakan pemeriksaan 7 saksi untuk tersangka TDE (Tengku Dzulmi Eldin), walikota Medan," ujar Febri ketika dikonfirmasi wartawan.
Adapun 7 saksi yang menjalani pemeriksan diantaranya Kadis Pariwisata Medan Agus Suriyono, Kadis Kesehatan Kota Medan Edwin Effendi, kepala Bappeda Kota Medan Irwan Ritonga, Kadis Pengendalian Penduduk dan Keluarga Bencana Usma Polita Nasution, Kadis Perumahan Kawasan Permukiman dan Penataan Ruang Benny Iskandar, Kabag Umum Kota Medan M Andi Syahputra, Kabid Pemberdayaan Masyarakat Dinas Pemberdayaan Perempuan Ernest Sembiring. (Joko Saputra)
text:
KPK Checks Again 7 Witnesses in Medan Mayor OTT Case
01 Nov 2019, 14:13 by Dadan SF


KPK Checks Again 7 Witnesses in Medan Mayor OTT Case

KBRN, Medan: The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has once again examined a number of witnesses of alleged bribery related to projects and positions in the Medan city government in the 2019 fiscal year, which named three suspects including Medan Mayor Tengku Dzulmi Eldin. The examination was conducted at the North Sumatra High Prosecutors' Office (Kejatisu), starting Friday (1/11) morning.
The summoning of a number of witnesses is also one of the alleged indications of participating in the Medan Mayor's official trip to Japan, as well as being involved in donating official travel funds without APBD funds.
From the observation of RRI, the KPK investigating team conducted an inspection since 9:00 a.m., in the Tri Krama Adhyaksa building. After undergoing the examination until just before 12.00 WIB, a number of witnesses came out of the building. Starting from the Head of Health Office of Medan City Edwin Effendi who came out around 11:30 a.m. Reviled by several questions by reporters, Edwin walked quickly to the car while answering briefly. Edwin said that he was only asked about the main tasks and functions as the Head of Health Office in Medan. However, Edwin was reluctant to explain in detail.
"No, it means that it is in accordance with the function and basic tasks. Yes, you don't need to take photos on the deck," Effendi said.
Edwin also claimed not to have participated in the Medan Mayor's official travel group tour to Japan related to sister city cooperation. "Nothing, not (coming to Japan). I am in accordance with my main duties and functions. Okay yes deck," Effendi answered.
Then not long after the Medan City General Head, Andi Syahputra, also left, but chose to remain silent. Not long afterwards another group of witnesses consisted of the Head of Population Control and Disaster Family Usma Polita Nasution, the Head of the Residential Area Housing and Spatial Planning Benny Iskandar, Medan City Education Office Head Marasutan Siregar, Medan Mayor Andika Protocol Staff came out at around 12:10 WIB.
However, there was not a single witness who could be asked for information related to the internal examination by the KPK team. Finally, Head of Medan Tourism Office Agus Suriyono also left the building. Not much said Suriyono. He only answered briefly.
"Prayer first, I want to pray first," he said briefly as he got into the car.
Until 13:00 WIB, a number of KPK teams were still in the Kejatisu office. At 13.15 WIB a number of witnesses appeared to re-enter the investigation room.
Such as Medan Marasutan Siregar Education Head, Medan Agus Suriyono Head of Tourism, Head of Housing and Settlement Area Benny Iskandar, and Medan City General Head M Andi Syahputra.
However, the three witnesses who were questioned had not yet returned to Kejatisu. The three Head of Health Office of Medan City Edwin Effendi, Head of Disaster Control and Family Disaster Usma Polita Nasution, and protocol staff of the Mayor of Medan Andika.
While two witnesses who, like the previous KPK information were also summoned today, namely the head of the Medan City Bappeda, Irwan Ritonga, and the Head of Community Empowerment, the Office of Women's Empowerment Ernest Sembiring, did not appear to be present at the Kejatisu.
As information from the KPK spokesman, Febry Diansyah, Friday (11/01/2019), the KPK investigating team again examined 7 (seven) people as witnesses for suspects who also involved the mayor of Medan Tengku Dzulmi Eldin.
"Today the KPK has scheduled an examination of 7 witnesses for TDE (Tengku Dzulmi Eldin), the mayor of Medan," Febri said when confirmed by reporters.
The 7 witnesses who underwent examinations included Head of Medan Tourism Agus Agus Suriyono, Head of Medan City Health Office Edwin Effendi, head of Medan City Bappeda Irwan Ritonga, Head of Population and Family Disaster Control Head of Usma Polita Nasution, Head of Housing and Settlement Area Benny Iskandar, City General Head Medan M Andi Syahputra, Head of Community Empowerment Ernest Sembiring Women's Empowerment Office. (Joko Saputra)
